content: of 6 more times 8 row total leave the 3 live stitches on the needle break yarn leaving an 8 tail and thread tail onto a tapestry needle as if closing the top of a hat * thread tapestry needle thru 3 stitches on waste yarn closest to the crown and back thru the last 3 stitches just knit * repeat remove knitting needle and waste yarn and attach securely repeat for remaining 3 loops i-cord when making a flat i-cord you do not slide your knitting from one end to the other therefore any type of needle will work for an 8 stitch flat i-cord the first 4 stitches are knit and the next 4 stitches are slipped with the yarn in front using your preferred method cast on 8 stitches k4 sl4wyif turn work repeat knit i-cord approximately 26 for a knot 32 for an undulating stream 38 for a bow bind off weave in ends and block launder the i-cord separately to avoid the possibility of color transfer i wet block my hat over a balloon inflated to approximately the desired circumference thread i-cord thru the loops to tack your i-cord stream in place thread your tapestry needle with a 6 piece of yarn make a few small stitches from inside the hat thru the back layer of the i-cord and bury the ends inside the i-cord repeat as you wish around 2/3 of the circumference of the hat leaving the back 1/3 free from tacking this will enable you to customize the fit yet continue to easily remove the i-cord for laundering tie the ends to achieve your perfect size wear your cappello con orgoglio 4
